src:
Stockholms filmfestival firar 30: ”Folk vill ta sig ut”
Stockholms filmfestival öppnar upp biosalongerna för trettionde året i rad. Årets tema kretsar kring maffia och organiserad brottslighet, något som festivalchefen Git Scheynius hoppas ska ge en mer autentisk bild av maffian än den romantiserade Hollywoodtolkningen.
06 Nov 2019, 04:29 by Isabella Nylander

















Ur ”Camorrans barn” av Claudio Giovannesi. Foto: Pressbild
Ur ”Bait” av Mark Jenkin. Foto: Thom-Axon
Ur ”Bait” av Mark Jenkin. Foto: Pressbild
Rubaiyat Hossain, regissör till filmen ”Made in Bangladesh”. Foto: Pressbild
Ur ”Made in Bangladesh”. Foto: Pressbild

text:
Stockholm Film Festival celebrates 30: "People want to get out"
Stockholm Film Festival opens cinemas for the thirtieth year in a row. This year's theme revolves around mafia and organized crime, something that festival director Git Scheynius hopes will give a more authentic image of the mafia than the romanticized Hollywood interpretation.
06 Nov 2019, 04:29 by Isabella Nylander

















From "Camorran's Children" by Claudio Giovannesi. Photo: Press image
From "Bait" by Mark Jenkin. Photo: Thom-Axon
From "Bait" by Mark Jenkin. Photo: Press image
Rubaiyat Hossain, director of the film "Made in Bangladesh". Photo: Press image
Made in Bangladesh. Photo: Press image
